title-group.article-title: Mutual Fund's R 2 as Predictor of Performance

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright © 2013 The Society for Financial Studies

abstract.p: We propose that fund performance can be predicted by its R 2 , obtained from a regression of its returns on a multifactor benchmark model. Lower R 2 indicates greater selectivity, and it significantly predicts better performance. Stock funds sorted into lowest-quintile lagged R 2 and highest-quintile lagged alpha produce significant annual alpha of 3.8%. Across funds, R 2 is positively associated with fund size and negatively associated with its expenses and manager's tenure.
